syllabus_info.title: Cambridge International AS & A Level Mathematics

learning_objectives.description: extend the idea of 'reverse differentiation' to include the integration of eᵃˣ⁺ᵇ, 1/(ax + b), sin(ax + b), cos(ax + b), sec²(ax + b) and 1/(x² + a²)
use trigonometrical relationships in carrying out integration
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. use of double-angle formulae to integrate sin²x or cos²(2x).

learning_objectives.description: integrate rational functions by means of decomposition into partial fractions
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: Restricted to types of partial fractions as specified in topic 3.1 above.

learning_objectives.description: recognise an integrand of the form kf'(x)/f(x), and integrate such functions
recognise when an integrand can usefully be regarded as a product, and use integration by parts
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. integration of x sin 2x, x²eˣ, lnx, x tan⁻¹x.

learning_objectives.description: use a given substitution to simplify and evaluate either a definite or an indefinite integral.
learning_objectives.notes_and_examples: e.g. to integrate sin² 2x cosx using the substitution u = sinx.
